programme.desc: . The series returns, similar to previous seasons, to present a variety of comedic sketches that combine mockery of reality, imitation of celebrities and public figures, and addressing many social topics in a satirical manner.(n)

. A Saudi man, who passed the usual age for marriage, becomes vulnerable to many family and societal pressures that urge him to get married. His mother and those close to him try to help him find a suitable wife, but he tries to evade this in various ways.(n)
( ) ( ) . The second season of the series follows the daily lives of the couple Abu Samel and Umm Samel and their many family situations.(n)

. Eight women in their 40s face many life challenges together, on the familial, emotional, and professional levels, as each one of them seeks to have stability in her life on all levels and to achieve her ambitions before it is too late.(n)

( ) . The events of the series take place in the mid-seventies in a popular neighborhood, around three girls, Aziza, Doha, and Atwa, and their attempts to search for freedom in a conservative society.(n)

( ) ( ) () () () () () () . The series focuses on the events of the Great Fitna (sedition), which took place from the time Caliph Uthman ibn Affan was martyred until Ali ibn Abi Talib took over, shedding light on Ali's martyrdom and the accession and then abdication of Al-Hasan, the accession of Mu'awiya and Yazid, and finally the martyrdom of Husayn in Karbala.(n)

() . Jarhi's life turns completely upside down after his father's death, as he finds himself in front of a mysterious key, huge wealth, and a dark past, surrounded by merciless opponents and enemies, and he must engage in many risky conflicts to protect his family and legacy.(n)
( ) ( ) . The second season of the series follows the daily lives of the couple Abu Samel and Umm Samel and their many family situations.(n)

. The series returns, similar to previous seasons, to present a variety of comedic sketches that combine mockery of reality, imitation of celebrities and public figures, and addressing many social topics in a satirical manner.(n)
( ) . In this reality presented by Ahmad Al Shugairi, the Saudi journalist seeks to summarize the positives witnessed by all sectors in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in a simple way.(n)
. A social documentary program, presented by journalist Malek Al-Rouqi, in which we learn about personalities who influenced human history, as the program aims to spread community awareness.(n)

() . Mohamed works as an air conditioning engineer, lives a routine life to the point of boredom, and tries hard to change his lifestyle in any way possible. () () ( ) . In the second season, Nassar finds himself in a great ordeal when he discovers that his daughter suffers from a serious illness that requires millions to treat, which prompts him to cooperate again with Khadr and work for Issa Al Wazzan, to confront a new and unexpected enemy.(n)

( ) . In the fifth season, after his return from death, Saber Al Maddah continues his wars against the jinn and is forced to confront the daughters of Satan as a new enemy with malicious goals. He seeks with all his determination to overcome them and get rid of their evils, as he was accustomed to before, and his personal life also witnesses many different developments.(n)

() . Mohamed works as an air conditioning engineer, lives a routine life to the point of boredom, and tries hard to change his lifestyle in any way possible. However, he falls in love with two completely different girls and plans to marry them at the same time, but he gets involved in many problems that fate has in store for him as a result of his actions.(n)

The series focuses on the events of the Great Fitna (sedition), which took place from the time Caliph Uthman ibn Affan was martyred until Ali ibn Abi Talib took over, shedding light on Ali's martyrdom and the accession and then abdication of Al-Hasan, the accession of Mu'awiya and Yazid, and finally the martyrdom of Husayn in Karbala.(n)

. After risking his life to save a teenager from a deadly fire, a middle-aged man becomes a village hero, but soon finds himself in the middle of a turf battle with a cunning thug.(n)

() . After her father's death, Nowayr must carry out his will and keep the secret of his huge fortune from the family. Still, conflicts and conspiracies ignite around her when everyone tries to reach the wealth and obtain it, which leads to the creation of unexpected tensions and disputes within the family.(n)

() . Officer Musa exploits his power to achieve personal gain in corrupt and twisted ways, which puts him in direct confrontation with the people he is blackmailing, while he discovers that his two siblings are counterfeiting dollars, and he finds himself in a difficult dilemma, torn between leaving them to confront the gangs alone, or managing this business himself to protect them.(n)
. A widow manipulates the lives of her sons and their spouses, sparking conflicts over tradition and personal desires, all in the name of her suffocating love for them.(n)

The series focuses on the events of the Great Fitna (sedition), which took place from the time Caliph Uthman ibn Affan was martyred until Ali ibn Abi Talib took over, shedding light on Ali's martyrdom and the accession and then abdication of Al-Hasan, the accession of Mu'awiya and Yazid, and finally the martyrdom of Husayn in Karbala.(n)

. Eight women in their 40s face many life challenges together, on the familial, emotional, and professional levels, as each one of them seeks to have stability in her life on all levels and to achieve her ambitions before it is too late.(n)

programme.title: Wild Heart
programme.desc: () (). Yaman got kidnapped from his family when he was young and grew up on the streets with his friends. They face many challenges, but everything changes in his life after meeting Rya.(n)

() () . Ellie saves her sister Kalthoum from a forced marriage, but their quest soon leads them to unforgiving streets, where they discover that what they experienced in the past was a lesser evil.(n)

() . () . After years of suffering, Rahma finds herself trapped in a toxic marriage. Seeking to take revenge and rewrite her destiny, Rahma musters the strength to confront her past and build a new life for herself.(n)

When she reunites with Jawad, her old flame, Fay, the janitor's daughter, falls in love with the same man, and the competition between them quickly becomes a conflict.(n)

. Fares returns to his village after long years of disappearing when his parents died. He falls in love with Yasma, but their relationship is harshly tested when he finds out who is the person behind his parents death.(n)
. An army captain called Sama looks for hard evidence to capture the gangster Safi who who carries out a number of crimes in secret.(n)
. A drama that follows the life of Hady and Rima as a blossoming romance brings them together at first sight, but as Hady's secrets gradually unfold, their relationship gets complicated.(n)

. A program that combines narrative, dialogue, and visual content, telling stories about famous Lebanese figures and historical milestones, in addition to archaeological sites, traditions, culinary heritage, and religious and social holidays.(n)

. 1996 . A regular morning program that hosts local politicians to talk about subjects that are important to the people in Lebanon and to debate the latest events in the political scene. 15 . The events take place inside a Damascus neighborhood in two time periods separated by 15 years, during the period that preceded the liberation of Damascus from the Ottoman occupation, and the period of the Ottoman control over the neighborhood, as a strong conflict erupts among the notables of the neighborhood to respond to and resist it.(n)

. The life of a psychiatrist intersects with many people around him, but their psychological complexes and the bad and distorted past of each of them lead to hidden and overt conflicts, which push them to commit heinous crimes, causing great losses for everyone.(n)

. Taking place in a Syrian rural village, the story deals with human relations, the concerns of countryside residents, the daily issues and problems of the youth and the elderly, and the various life challenges they face.(n)

() () () . The domineering merchant Shafaat tries to exploit the naive rural young man Imam, who recently arrived in Cairo, to seduce him and make him fall for her even though he is younger than her. Everyone around her seeks to keep him out of her way, but everything changes when he falls in love with a young girl. Consumed with jealousy, Shafaat plans revenge on him.(n)

( ) . The events depict the well-known story of Raya and Sakina from a different perspective and in two different time periods, as they are acquitted of everything they have been accused of, namely kidnapping and killing women in order to steal their belongings. They are rather portrayed as patriots working with the national resistance against the British occupation in Egypt.(n)

. It follows the life of gypsies, and sheds light on the conflicts between two families over money and influence, as a tragic accident that affects everyone occurs, making revenge the only way to change the course of events.(n)

. A professional con artist works for a group of people who carry out illegal activities. Then he falls victim to a conspiracy and is sent to prison. When he is released, he tries to rebuild his life and makes new alliances while planning revenge on those who wronged him.(n)

. Taking place in a Syrian rural village, the story deals with human relations, the concerns of countryside residents, the daily issues and problems of the youth and the elderly, and the various life challenges they face.(n)

1928 . The events revolve around the making of the first Syrian motion picture in 1928, and the difficulties that surrounded it, shedding light on many aspects of life in that period, especially with the presence of French colonialism in Syria.(n)

( ) . The journalist and actor Abdulrahman Aldayeen hosts a group of Arab stars and artists, and the focus of the conversation revolves around their personal and professional lives. They discuss their opinions on many topics and life issues in an honest manner and far from the gray area.(n)

. Four sisters suffer from social phobia in dealing with the opposite sex, and they strive to achieve their dreams amidst the challenges of daily life. However, their lives are turned upside down after the husband of one of them is killed, as she saw in a dream, so she turns to her sisters to search together for a solution to remove her from the list of suspects.(n)

. A ballet dancer loses her sight and then finds hope in a young Syrian refugee who restores her self-confidence and falls in love with her. As her father intervenes with his influence and power to end their relationship, she finds herself at a crossroads between her sweetheart Ghaith and moving forward on her path.(n)

. The events revolve around a family whose names all begin with the letter S, and many funny situations occur between them in their daily lives as they seek to solve their personal and common problems.(n)

() . Shaha, a strong and controlling woman, always imposes her ideas and decisions on the members of her family, which results in many crises and problems among them, as they enter into daily conflicts because of her.(n)

( ) 20 . The brilliant lawyer Abdel Sattar El Kaf is involved in a tragic car accident, and as a result, he enters a coma that lasts for 20 years. When he wakes up from his coma, he finds himself faced with strange things and concepts that he has never witnessed before. He must keep up with the times and the developments that have occurred but finds it difficult to do so.(n)

. It follows four young men who have had a strong friendship since childhood. Each of them has a different personality, but they are united by their love for video games. () () . In season 2, Gawdar continues to suffer with his enemies, the conspiracies against him persist, and the Shameen resume their efforts to use Gawdar to gain access to the four treasures.(n)

() . The events revolve around the Damascene Al Safi family that controls the tobacco trade with an iron fist and sets strict rules against anyone who competes with it in the market, which ignites the fire of war when a strong competitor appears.(n)

() () . In a marble factory in the Shaq El Thoaban area, Fahd works as a craftsman after escaping from his family in Upper Egypt after facing injustice. . A divorced woman, the mother of a child and a teenage daughter, lives a desperate life full of daily life challenges. She finds a chance to live again when she enters the university in place of her niece after she suffers an accident. She then lives a double life between being an ideal mother and the cheerful young woman she wants to be.(n)

. After losing his wife tragically and being exposed to severe injustice, one of the most dangerous thugs decides to change his criminal lifestyle and take care of raising his son in honorable ways. He begins to face many challenges and difficulties in order to achieve this, which makes him become a popular hero in the eyes of his family and the people of his area.(n)

. A young prosecutor takes on the task of investigating a mysterious murder that took place at a train station. While searching for the killer and trying to uncover the secrets of the crime, he finds himself stuck between the evidence and his personal intuition, facing a number of suspects.(n)

However, she rejects that situation and then discovers that he has cheated on her with her close friend. The conflict between them develops to include members of their family and friends.(n)

() () () . The domineering merchant Shafaat tries to exploit the naive rural young man Imam, who recently arrived in Cairo, to seduce him and make him fall for her even though he is younger than her. Everyone around her seeks to keep him out of her way, but everything changes when he falls in love with a young girl. Consumed with jealousy, Shafaat plans revenge on him.(n)
